problem: When simplified, what is the value of $\sqrt{3} \times 3^{\frac{1}{2}} + 12 \div 3 \times 2 - 4^{\frac{3}{2}}$?
chatgpt_solution: We simplify each exponent separately. We have $3^{\frac12}=\sqrt3$ and $4^{\frac{3}{2}}=\sqrt{4^3} = \sqrt{4\cdot 4 \cdot 4} = 4\cdot 2 = 8$. We plug these results into the original expression to get $\sqrt{3} \cdot \sqrt{3} + 12\div 3 \times 2 - 8$. We simplify further to get $3+ 4 \times 2 - 8$. Multiplying $4\times 2$ gives $8$, so our expression equals $3+ 8- 8 = \boxed{3}$.
